lines.text: As the first born, am I not the rightful heir?
Right or wrong has little to do with this; it's a matter of political necessity.
My heart, my life, are in these hands.
And both are safe and sound.
I only have a handful of men. Brave musketeers, true, but not enough of them to take a fortress. But - we can always try.
Not by force, my friend. By cunning.
What poet of antiquity first warned us to beware of Greeks bearing gifts?
Did you know my father well, D'Artagnan?
Enough to love him ever.
What a cunning vixen you have become, for one so innocent.
Necessity is my tutor, to my shame.
Back there you called me "my lord", and you risked your own life to save mine. I must understand! What is it you want of me? Who am I?
[loses consciousness]
You, my prince, are the true King of France.
Nightmares, nightmares! Dear God, bring me some sweet dreams!
Is there no one I can trust?
None. You are a King.
How shrewd you are, Colbert. Perhaps - too shrewd?
Now I shall play the man in the iron mask. And Fouquet, the fool.
He's haunted by the mystery, it would be an act of mercy to let him know.
We must say nothing yet.
We should tell him his true identity.
You and I are flirting with high treason, my friend. Let Phillipe remain ignorant for his own sake, as well as our own. The rack can loosen any man's tongue - even that of a Prince.
What are you?
A Minister.
Not of the Church, I'll be bound.
Perhaps I missed my vocation.
The Church should thank God.
We must not act
[looks meaningfully at D'Artagnan]
impetuously.
Impetuously!
The King, Fouquet, is dead. Long live the King.
Our ballet has bored you, my dear?
Your majesty misconstrues.
Give us your opinion then.
Very nice.
Nice. We are overwhelmed by your praise.
But please, don't let me interrupt your exercise.
Nonsense, it's a welcome intrusion for an aging swordsman.
You find a simple flower more beautiful than our creation?
Only in that its beauty is natural, not painted on or contrived.
There
[shreds her flower to pieces]
you see how transitory your natural beauty is.
If you are to rule this great nation, you must learn restraint. Keep cool in battle, or in sports. Be angry - but in cold blood.
